meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the cat upleapt onto the table to catch a mouse.
meanings.sent2: The athlete upleapt over the hurdle with ease.
meanings.sent3: The frog upleapt so high that it surprised the nearby birds.
meanings.sent4: Her heart upleapt with joy when she saw her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel upleapt from branch to branch, showing off its agility.

meanings.definition: Upleapt: to have jumped up quickly
meanings.sent1: The dog upleapt onto the couch to cuddle with its owner.
meanings.sent2: The child upleapt from the bed when they heard the ice cream truck outside.
meanings.sent3: The balloon upleapt into the sky after being released by the little girl.
meanings.sent4: His spirits upleapt when he received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit upleapt out of its burrow at the first sign of danger.

meanings.definition: Upleapt: to have leaped up suddenly
meanings.sent1: The ninja upleapt from the shadows to surprise his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The deer upleapt over the fence to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent3: The idea upleapt in her mind like a spark of inspiration.
meanings.sent4: The flames upleapt from the bonfire, lighting up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The rocket upleapt into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.
